body_html: This is expected. You can think of .clone() as doing + 0 - the output is a result of a computation that involves a. So both e.backward(...) and d.backward(...) will propagate gradients back to a.
body_text: This is expected. You can think of .clone() as doing + 0 - the output is a result of a computation that involves a. So both e.backward(...) and d.backward(...) will propagate gradients back to a.
body: This is expected. You can think of `.clone()` as doing `+ 0` - the output is a result of a computation that involves `a`. So both `e.backward(...)` and `d.backward(...)` will propagate gradients back to `a`.
